channel.title: Image Flame vs Text Flame, and some staff stuff
channel.description:
Well, I decided to post this on behalf of AMERIKA's unfair moderation.
First off, [b]this staff is fucked up[/b]. Look at M.Dog311, the one who requested AMERIKA's moderation. Then look at `Rich, who locks every topic in the general section that might be fun to talk about, or where you just post a picture. That's also fucked up.
Now onto the topic. I want to point out some stuff staff members might not look at (Note: I used AMERIKA's situtation here).
There's 2 people on a forum. Person A and Person B. Person A posts a topic breaking the rules, and makes a fool of himself. Person B posts an image with the text that has something to do with a face palm. Now, a bad staff member (M.Dog311) would end up locking the topic properly, but then punish Person B too. Why? He used an image? If Person B had posted something like "*Face palm* Wrong section...", nothing would've happened. The topic would've been locked, and Person B would've remained fine.
You see what happened there? Staff (I don't know about all) treat images as worse than text, even if the image is representing something that could be expressed in words.
Oh, and I know AMERIKA's case had to do with failing, but that's beside the point. Look at the face palm situation.
Now some staff member might fight back saying "He broke rule number #, which states no flaming." That would be correct, however, if they enforced that rule with [i]everyone[/i] on the forum, there would probably be green, yellow, and maybe even blue dots everywhere you go.
They also might argue with "He's been warned before, etc..." or "He knows better.", and again, that's also true. But like I said before, that's not the case with most members. It's not enforced.
Finally, their response could be "We don't have time to chase every member around the forum." If that's the case, then don't even bother tracking down specific members, because that's unfair.
So my suggestion is either enforce the flaming rule or be specific with image flaming, or stop unfairly punishing members.
Wait, they're likely to fight back with that too, with something like "We're not unfairly punishing members, because they deserved it." That's right, but also wrong at the same time. Sure, they might have deserved it, but it's unfair because you're letting other members get away with what another got punished for.
Oh, and last but not least, this isn't a suggestion topic. Just a point of view, and I guess a little rant, I want others to discuss.
That's all,
~Lin

item.title: Image Flame vs Text Flame, and some staff stuff
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

I’ve said this time, and time again. All complaints(and criticism for that matter) are to be sent to an administrator(I should point out, is an exception). I expected more from all the staff that posted here.

Read full topic
item.source: Image Flame vs Text Flame, and some staff stuff

item.title: Image Flame vs Text Flame, and some staff stuff
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

Nothing. Just saying that if you were a senior moderator, you wouldn’t have had to request it.

Read full topic
item.source: Image Flame vs Text Flame, and some staff stuff

item.title: Image Flame vs Text Flame, and some staff stuff
item.dc:creator: @m.dog311 m.dog311
item.description:
@m.dog311 wrote:

[quote=“Jc22493, post:7, topic:295069”][quote author=m.dog311 link=topic=390181.msg2913002#msg2913002 date=1250214405]
AMERIKA’s moderation was not unjust at all. I did, in-fact request it. But as you know, I can not place the moderation. I had it placed by a Global mod, which if he had saw something wrong with it, the moderation would not have been there. It was then later reviewed by another Global mod. Neither of them found anything wrong.
[/quote]
Why don’t you request the other 100,000 other infractions that should be given though? You only requested one for AMERIKA, and that’s what’s unfair to me.[/quote]
Because I generally don’t view replies. It was the image that really stuck out.[quote=“Jc22493, post:10, topic:295069”][quote author=m.dog311 link=topic=390181.msg2913009#msg2913009 date=1250214802]

AMERIKA’s moderation was not unjust at all. I did, in-fact request it. But as you know, I can not place the moderation. I had it placed by a Global mod, which if he had saw something wrong with it, the moderation would not have been there. It was then later reviewed by another Global mod. Neither of them found anything wrong.

Why don’t you request the other 100,000 other infractions that should be given though? You only requested one for AMERIKA, and that’s what’s unfair to me.

Because I generally don’t view replies. It was the image that really stuck out. Not only this, but I also mod like newty, and therefore do not always notice the text replies that are breaking the rules.
[/quote]

[quote][20:18:41] ur stupid mdog311
[20:18:47] hence why ur not a senior mod[/quote]

I don’t think you’re stupid though.[/quote]
That had what to do with this?

Read full topic
item.source: Image Flame vs Text Flame, and some staff stuff

[20:18:41] ur stupid mdog311 [20:18:47] hence why ur not a senior mod

I don’t think you’re stupid though.

AMERIKA’s moderation was not unjust at all. I did, in-fact request it. But as you know, I can not place the moderation. I had it placed by a Global mod, which if he had saw something wrong with it, the moderation would not have been there. It was then later reviewed by another Global mod. Neither of them found anything wrong.
[/quote]
Why don’t you request the other 100,000 other infractions that should be given though? You only requested one for AMERIKA, and that’s what’s unfair to me.[/quote]

item.title: Image Flame vs Text Flame, and some staff stuff
item.dc:creator: @NewbieNewty Newty
item.description:
@NewbieNewty wrote:

Now some staff member might fight back saying "He broke rule number #, which states no flaming." That would be correct, however, if they enforced that rule with everyone on the forum, there would probably be green, yellow, and maybe even blue dots everywhere you go.

They also might argue with “He’s been warned before, etc…” or “He knows better.”, and again, that’s also true. But like I said before, that’s not the case with most members. It’s not enforced.

Finally, their response could be “We don’t have time to chase every member around the forum.” If that’s the case, then don’t even bother tracking down specific members, because that’s unfair.

I casually browse the forums, just like any other user, accept that when I see something that is breaking a rule I have the power to do something about it. So I do. I do not track down specific member’s, I just happen to view their topics, and when there is a rule broken, the topic will be locked or the user infracted.

As for image posts being the same as text based posts: That is absolutly untrue, “a picture says a million words”. A picture based post can stir far more shit then a text post.

Read full topic
item.source: Image Flame vs Text Flame, and some staff stuff

AMERIKA’s moderation was not unjust at all. I did, in-fact request it. But as you know, I can not place the moderation. I had it placed by a Global mod, which if he had saw something wrong with it, the moderation would not have been there. It was then later reviewed by another Global mod. Neither of them found anything wrong.

Why don’t you request the other 100,000 other infractions that should be given though? You only requested one for AMERIKA, and that’s what’s unfair to me.

item.title: Image Flame vs Text Flame, and some staff stuff
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

I totally agree. I think that AMERIKA should have received an infraction, but only a warning. If he had posted in text, “Your post tastes of fail.”, he wouldn’t have been moderated. He might not even have been warned.

The staff members have the power to see some posts as ‘spam’ and some as ‘not spam’, but since the staff members, excluding Taharok, don’t warn most violators fairly, AMERIKA shouldn’t even receive a warning even though he broke the rules, despite what I stated in the first paragraph.

Read full topic
item.source: Image Flame vs Text Flame, and some staff stuff

item.title: Image Flame vs Text Flame, and some staff stuff
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

[quote="`Rich, post:3, topic:295069"][quote author=SilentCJ link=topic=390181.msg2912984#msg2912984 date=1250213651]
I agree, that last case with AMERIKA was unfair.
I see loads of members everyday posting, swearing their heads off, insulting others, and sometimes getting away with just a small infraction, yet AMERIKA posts one ‘fail’ picture, and he’s moderated?
[/quote]

he was given a moderation cause he was already warned

also, I do agree that some things are taken too seriously, but I really don’t see a problem with most of the things I lock.[/quote]To be honest, I did go overboard on that part. Most of the stuff you lock is for a purpose, but some shouldn’t be locked.

Read full topic
